comment.body: @Nora: Hover over your comment/post, press the pencil icon, then you will see the delete button
it's not in the works yet
@Border0464fred: Both possible, so you will able to opt-out DHT if you want.

- Download a bitcoin wallet software, eg.: https://electrum.org
- Wallet > Private keys > Import
- Enter your site's private key (if you cloned it it can be found in data/users.json)
- That's it, it will notify you if you have new transaction and you can spend it via the send tab
@Whacko: I could be possible, but I have not through about it yet.
@Loligod: Translation plugin released 2 months ago
Simple ZeroNet sites that stores the people's posts, comments, votes. You can simply create your own hub by cloning any of the current ones.

@Jjg: By default ZeroNet site are only modifiable by it's owner, but it's possible to define directory where other people able to submit his/her own content. (like comments on your blog)
ZeroMe profiles are stored in this user-modifiable area on a hub site.

@Jjg: By default ZeroNet sites has 10MB limit. To avoid this limit, the user data on ZeroMe is stored in hub sites. This way you will only download and receive updates for profiles you are interested in: the hub sites you have added in your client.
For most of the other sites (eg. ZeroTalk, ZeroBlog) 10MB limit is enough, so the data is stored directly on the site.
You have to sign the data/users/content.json file: Open the sidebar, enter `data/users/content.json` to the bottom, press sign, then publish

It's up to the site/hub owner.
They can remove the content they don't want to see, but moderating a network that offers anonymity is harder than clearnet, since your internet identity is not connected to content at all.
I had removed the problematic content from ZeroMe hubs I created (Orage/Blue/Red/Green), but there are other hubs I have no control.
The freedom has downsides and It's not for everyone. If you decides to visit an uncensored network you have to prepare for that kind of things, but it will improve with time when the site/hub owners will take more time to managing their site.
@Journalist: If you support decentralization, then there is no place for "only official hubs".
@Journalist: Like I said I have no control over that hub, so you should ask this from the hub operator.

It uses ssl if possible, but some client has broken openssl, so it's not possible. Even if you use ssl it's still possible to decrypt the data with active ssl proxy, because the certs are self-signed. (so MITM can see your data)
But since every data on zeronet is verified on client side (by ECC or SHA512) modification of this data is not possible by MITM and by that the broken transport layer security is not a big problem for ZeroNet.
Tor .onion connections solves this problem, they totally MITM safe.
Have you tried to restart you client?
@Rythyrix: Can you please give me one failed file? Go to ZeroMail, open the sidebar and you will see the list in the missing files section.
@Rythyrix: Thanks for the files, it would help if you could upload ~10 lines before and after a "this file is archived!" log entry from the more detailed log/debug.log file.

Similar to clearnet: The site owner can ban/remove user based on zeroid identifier.
I don't see how would blockchain solve this problem. Other easy solution would be shared ignore lists.

Thanks, updated the tutorial on medium.com.
As for the error: looks like for some unknown reasons there is an inconsistency between the "content.db" cache and the real file system.
I testing a fix for it, but try to create the "data/users/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/content.json" file manually with the content "{}"
@Glightstar: Try press Reload the Rebuild button on the sidebar.

You need to add an "optional" regex pattern to the content.json and zeronet will handles the rest.
eg.: `"optional": "(?!avatar).*jpg",` [in zerome's user files](merged-ZeroMe/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/data/users/1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj/content.json) means every jpg file in user directory is optional file except avatar.jpg
Yes, currently there is no global way, you need to add it to the content.json file you will use to sign the files.

If the json file is valid and same as other user's then it should update the date_added correctly.
Can you give link to your bot's data.json file?
@Binchan: It's a simple misspelling: you need `date_added`, but you have dat**a**_added in the file
